computing_environment: Linux (Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server release 6.4)
data_usage: The multi-model mean change in the annual maximum number of consecutive dry days for the rapid emissions reductions (RCP 2.6) scenario, for 2070-2099 relative to 1971-2000, was plotted for North America.
methodology:
1. The annual maximum number of consecutive dry days CLIMDEX data (RCP 2.6 scenario) for each model was re-gridded to a common grid of 1.5 x 1.5 degrees.
2. For each model listed below, at each grid point, the mean annual maximum number of consecutive dry days was calculated for two periods (1971-2000 and 2070-2099) by averaging the annual values.
3. Multi-model mean values were then calculated for 1971-2000 and 2070-2099 by averaging the period means from the 24 models listed below, at each grid point.
4. The percentage change was calculated at each grid point (relative to the 1971-2000 mean) and plotted on a map.
5. The percentage of models with differences greater than zero was calculated and stippling was added to the maps for percentages greater than 80% or less than 20%.

The following models were used:
ACCESS1-0
BNU-E
CanES2
CCSM4
CESM1-BGC
CMCC-CM
CNRM-CM5
CSIRO-Mk3-6-0
GFDL-CM3
GFDL-ESM2G
GFDL-ESM2M
HadGEM2-CC
HadGEM2-ES
inmcm4
IPSL-CM5A-LR
IPSL-CM5A-MR
IPSL-CM5B-LR
MIROC5
MIROC-ESM-CHEM
MIROC-ESM
MPI-ESM-LR
MPI-ESM-MR
MRI-CGCM3
NorESM1-M
